DOC.brief_summary: Aortocoronary bypass graft failure common associate high morbidity mortality . Failure saphenous vein graft common failure internal mammary artery graft . Whether early graft angiography reduce bypass graft failure remain unknown . The Cardiac CAtheterization Bypass Graft Patency Rate Optimization ( CABG-PRO ) randomized-controlled pilot study phase III , double-blind , randomized-controlled pilot trial randomize 170 patient undergoing coronary artery bypass graft surgery early ( dismissal ) graft angiography vs. early graft angiography . Coronary angiography perform 12 month , determine whether compare early graft angiography , early graft angiography result : 1. low per patient angiographic bypass graft failure ( least one graft ) rate ( define â‰¥75 % diameter stenosis least one bypass graft ) ( primary efficacy endpoint ) 2. low per graft failure rate , per graft occlusion rate , per patient bypass graft occlusion rate ( least one bypass graft ) ( secondary endpoint ) 3. low incidence major adverse cardiac event ( death , nonfatal myocardial infarction , nonfatal stroke , coronary revascularization , composite death/myocardial infarction ) ( secondary endpoint ) Intravascular ultrasonography near-infrared spectroscopy also perform least one bypass graft baseline ( early graft angiography group ) 12-month angiographic follow-up evaluate structural bypass graft change occur coronary artery bypass graft surgery ( secondary endpoint ) .
DOC.brief_title: Cardiac CAtheterization Bypass Graft Patency Rate Optimization : CABG-PRO Randomized-controlled Pilot Study
